title.narrative: Initiative Think Tank - Fonds spécial pour l'Afrique subsaharienne
Think Tank Initiative-Opportunity Funds for Sub-Saharan Africa

description.narrative:
Description Ce projet permettra d'octroyer des subventions à même un fonds spécial pour l'Afrique subsaharienne dans le cadre de l'ITT (Initiative Think Tank).
L'Initiative Think Tank L'ITT est un programme financé par plusieurs bailleurs de fonds et voué à la consolidation d'institutions de recherches indépendantes sur les politiques dans les pays en développement afin de leur permettre de produire des études sérieuses après à alimenter et à influencer les politiques. Cela passe principalement par un financement de base et une aide technique qui permettent aux organismes bénéficiaires de réaliser leurs objectifs à long terme en termes de qualité de la recherche, de liaison avec les politiques et de performance organisationnelle globale.
Objet du Fonds spécial Dans cette cinquième et dernière année de la Phase 1, l'ITT offre à ses bénéficiaires une aide financière supplémentaire sous la forme du Fonds spécial.
L'objet de ce fonds est d'accorder des ressources supplémentaires qui permettront de financer des activités non prévues au budget des bénéficiaires selon les plans de travail dressés pour l'

Research Description
This project will provide funding for the Think Tank Initiative's (TTI) Opportunity Fund for grantees in sub-Saharan Africa.
About the Think Tank Initiative TTI is a multi-funder program dedicated to strengthening independent policy research organizations in developing countries, enabling them to better provide sound research that informs and influences policy. This is done primarily through core funding and technical support to allow grantee organizations to achieve their long-term objectives in the areas of research quality, policy linkages, and overall organizational performance.
Purpose of the Opportunity Fund In this fifth and final year of Phase 1, TTI is offering its grantees an additional financial support through the Opportunity Fund.
The fund's purpose is to provide supplementary funding for activities that are not already budgeted for in the grantees' TTI work plans for 2013-2014. The supplementary fund will allow them to implement activities above and beyond those that have been planned and budgeted. To be eligible, grantees must have allocated and used all Phase 1 core grant funds by September 30, 2014.
This additional source of funding will serve to support TTI grantees to organize and implement institution-specific or collaborative organizational development activities. The goal of these activities will be to enhance financial and administrative management capacity, and strengthen monitoring and evaluation. It will also support the building blocks for future research activities, including skills and knowledge, strategic partnerships, targeted studies, and other preparatory work that will help improve research quality.
